creditline: Gift of Leo and Doris Hodroff
description: Chinese export blue and white; bell-shaped body painted with continuous scene of figures in misty landscape between lotus-lappet bands; cylindrical waisted shaft has vertical lotus sprays
text: The bell-shaped body of this candlestick was among the first Western forms to be reproduced in Chinese porcelain. It corresponds to early 17th century pewter and brass candsticks, which may have been sent to China as a sample, as candlesticks were previously unknown there.
title: Candlestick
